pageContext.claim: “If you don't have the wall, you're going to have people coming in.”
pageContext.analysis: This doesn't track with reality. Any wall would be built a mile or so inland from the border. Many of those attempting to immigrate are Central Americans seeking asylum. To petition for asylum, a person needs to be on U.S. soil under current law. So in theory, immigrants could cross the border and file a legally valid petition for asylum before reaching Trump's wall. The incentive would still exist.
